value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">31</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The great house that <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hlat" key="Latimer, Hugh">Latimer</rs> deplored becomes</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">solid and entire in the pages of Lady <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-aclif" key="Clifford, Ann">Anne Clifford</rs>s</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">diary. From childhood she was tenacious of her hereditary</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rights--her father had the right to carry the Kings</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sword <quote source="#" rend="inline">"and so it lineally 
            <choice>
              <sic>descnded</sic>
              <corr>descended</corr>
            </choice> to me.</quote><add hand="ms" place="inline">/</add> All her youth</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">she fought, against kinsmen, husband and the king himself</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for her lxmxmxx right to inherit 
            <choice>
              <sic>he</sic>
              <corr>her</corr>
            </choice> lands in <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-west" key="Westmoreland">Westmoreland</rs>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"... I would 
            <choice>
              <sic>bever</sic>
              <corr>never</corr>
            </choice> part from 
            <choice>
              <sic>estmoreland</sic>
              <corr>Westmoreland</corr>
            </choice> while I lived</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">upon any condition whatsoever"</quote> she told him. When the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lands and the five castles were hers, she instantly began</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rebuilding; Not only the land was hers, but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">diamond buttons, rubies, fur cloaks. She As if to solidify</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>he</sic>
              <corr>her</corr>
            </choice> possessions she wrote out inventories of them. Family</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">love is in part the 
            <choice>
              <sic>drire</sic>
              <corr>[desire? drive?]</corr>
            </choice> to hand on her 
            <choice>
              <sic>proprty</sic>
              <corr>property</corr>
            </choice>. She sends</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for her 
            <choice>
              <sic>gran</sic>
              <corr>grand</corr>
            </choice> children in order that they may taste the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">delight of possession and so refresh her own satisfaction.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add hand="ms" place="inline">[</add>The living body is robed 
            <choice>
              <sic>slendidly</sic>
              <corr>splendidly</corr>
            </choice> in taffetas and satins.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the dead body is 
            <choice>
              <sic>seale</sic>
              <corr>sealed</corr>
            </choice> in lead to preserve it from decay.<add hand="ms" place="inline">]</add></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The sense of the body permeates her pages. All 
            <choice>
              <sic>movemnts</sic>
              <corr>movements</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">become spectacular. Crowds attend her.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Six bay horses 
            <choice>
              <sic>darg</sic>
              <corr>drag</corr>
            </choice> the 
            <choice>
              <sic>coah</sic>
              <corr>coach</corr>
            </choice>. The 
            <choice>
              <sic>coah</sic>
              <corr>coach</corr>
            </choice> is lined with 
            <choice>
              <sic>grreen</sic>
              <corr>green</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">cloth, and laced with green and black silk lace. She is</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for ever asserting 
            <choice>
              <sic>he</sic>
              <corr>her</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice>
              <sic>idnetity</sic>
              <corr>identity</corr>
            </choice>. 
            <choice>
              <sic>he</sic>
              <corr>She</corr>
            </choice> has her initials carved</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">even over farm hose walls. This is her property; this land</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is hers 
            <choice>
              <sic>b</sic>
              <corr>by</corr>
            </choice> right. Certain flesh and blood--</l>
